description:
With an award-winning team of attorneys, our law firm, Kennedy Berkley Yarnevich & Williamson in Hays, Kansas, provides representation in the following areas:

  • Family law: Child support, paternity, divorce
  • Estate planning: Wills, trusts, probate
  • Business law: Banking, agribusiness, contracts, mergers
  • Personal injury: Workplace injuries, car accidents, medical malpractice
  • Employment law: Employee misconduct, forming policies, terminations
  • Social Security Disability: Social Security Disability Insurance and Supplemental Security Income

Essentially, people who come to our law firm find the support they need no matter what type of legal situation they are navigating. Our attorneys combine decades of experience in and out of the courtroom protecting the rights of the people they serve. We are proficient in the industries our clients belong to and have the ability to create strategies that set them up for success.

Thanks to our personalized approach and track record of results, our attorneys have earned a number of honors such as being named to Super Lawyers list; holding the highest peer rating possible of AV Preeminent* from Martindale-Hubbell; and being listed in the American Institute of Bankruptcy Attorneys: 10 Best.

The reviews from our clients far outweigh these accolades, however. People who work with our law firm note our excellent communication and approachability. We have four offices, located in Hays, Overland Park, Garden City and Salina, from which we serve people throughout Ellis, Finney, Johnson and Saline counties. To accommodate our clients, Kennedy Berkley Yarnevich & Williamson accepts credit cards.

* AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
